translated: The Monastic Code of the Elders
The Great Analysis🔽The chapter on training rules
The second training rule on leaning

original: Tena samayena buddho bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: tena samayena buddhaḥ bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,

original: Tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyā bhikkhū khambhakatā antaraghare nisīdanti …pe….
analyzed: tena kho pana samayena chabbaggiyāḥ bhikkhū khambha katāḥ antara ghare nisīdanti pe
translated: the monks from the group of six were leaning while sitting in inhabited areas. …

analyzed: na khambhakataḥ antaraghare nisīdissāmi iti sikkhā karaṇīyā ati
translated: “‘I will not lean while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
One should not lean while sitting in an inhabited area.

original: Yo anādariyaṁ paṭicca ekato vā ubhato vā khambhaṁ katvā antaraghare nisīdati, āpatti dukkaṭassa.
analyzed: yaḥ anādariyam paṭicca ekatas vā ubhatas vā khambham katvā antara ghare nisīdati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If a monk, out of disrespect, leans with one or both elbows on his knees while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: anāpatti  a san cit ca  assatiyā
translated: There is no offense🔽if it is unintentional,
if he is not thinking,🔽if he does not know,
if he is sick,🔽if he is traveling,🔽if there is a danger,
if he is the first offender.🔽The second training rule is finished.
